questions.text: A patient came with a clean cut wound with a history of tetanus vaccine 10 years ago. Next step?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Single dose tetanus yield This statement is true since the patient has taken a tetanus vaccine 10 years ago and presents with a clean cut wound.

Highyeild:

Immune category A : has had a complete course of Toxoid of booster dose in the past 5 years. B : has had a complete course of Toxoid of booster dose more than 5 years ago but less than 10 years. C : has had a complete course of Toxoid of booster dose more than 10 years ago. D : has not had a complete course of toxoid or immunity status unknown.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, C and D are false.

Table:

#MANTRA

questions.text: Which of the following vaccines do you recommend for a 10 year old school child according to the national immunization schedule?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Td

Highyeild:

The immunization schedule may be altered to suit the local needs of individuals and groups. Interruption of the schedule with a delay between doses does not interfere with the final immunity achieved. There is no bias for the mistaken belief that if a second dose is delayed, the immunization schedule must be started all over again.

Extraedge:

Immunization is frequently postponed if children are I'll or malnourished.

Table:

#MANTRA

questions.text: Study among two groups of people working in aniline dye factory for 20 years conducted study with people working in factories and those who are office workers of the same factory. What type of study is this?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Retrospective cohort study Retrospective cohort study is the correct statement since outcomes have all occurred before the start of the investigation.

Highyeild:

Epidemiological studies can be classified as observational studies and experimental studies with further subdivisions, which are as follows: Observational studies Descriptive studies Analytical studies Ecological or correlational with populations as unit of study Cross-sectional or prevalence with individuals as unit of study. Case-control or case reference with individuals as unit of study. Cohort or follow-up with individuals as unit of study. In retrospective cohort study we go back in time. Experimental studies or intervention studies Randomized controlled trails or clinical trials with patients as unit of study Field trials with healthy people as unit of study Community trials or community intervention studies with communities as unit of study.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A. The case control study has three distinct features. Both exposure and outcome have occurred before the start of the study. The study proceeds backwards. It uses a control or comparison group. Option B. Prospective cohort study has not yet occurred at the time the investigation begins. Option D. Intervention study is one where you actively intervene.

questions.text: What is the best parameter for assessing the health status of a community, a sensitive indicator of availability and utilisation of health services?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

IMR IMR is the true statement since it is a market of overall health.

Highyeild:

Infant mortality is the death of an infant before his or her first birthday. The infant mortality rate is the number of infant deaths for every 1,000 live births. In addition to giving us key information about maternal and infant health, the infant mortality rate is an important marker of the overall health of a society.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Other Options: HDI, Immunization rates and Literacy rates do not predict overall health of a society.

Extraedge:

The causes of infant mortality include birth defects, birth asphyxia, pneumonia, congenital malformations, term birth complications such as abnormal presentation of the fetus umbilical cord prolapse, or prolonged labor, neonatal infection, diarrhea, malaria, measles, and malnutrition.

questions.text: In healthcare, colombo plan is focused on?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Provide cobalt therapy units

Highyeild:

The Colombo Plan is a regional intergovernmental organization that began operations on 1 July 1951. Provision of one Cobalt-60 teletherapy unit is done under “Colombo Plan”.

questions.text: Potential years of life is calculated as:

options.label: A
options.text: Years of life lost due to premature death

options.label: B
options.text: Years of life lived with morbidity

options.label: D
options.text: Years of life lived in poor quality

questions.correct_answer: A. Years of life lost due to premature death
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Years of life lost due to premature death

Highyeild:

One DALY represents the loss of the equivalent of one year of full health. DALYs for a disease or health condition are the sum of the years of life lost to due to premature mortality (YLLs) and the years lived with a disability (YLDs) due to prevalent cases of the disease or health condition in a population.

Extraedge:

QALY is calculated using utility value. HALE is the best and most important indicator of disability.

questions.text: A 22 year pregnant woman presented to a sub center with a history of eating papaya. She is suspecting that she might have aborted the child. You have examined the patient thoroughly and the pregnancy is safe and asked her to go back home. Which health worker will be sent for rural visit for this kind of a situation?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

ASHA They have role in rural visits to check up on the woman who has been counselled.

Highyeild:

An Anganwadi is a type of rural child care centre in India. They were started by the Indian government in 1975 as part of the Integrated Child Development Services program to combat child hunger and malnutrition. A typical Anganwadi center provides basic health care in a village. Basic health care activities include contraceptive counseling and supply, nutrition education and supplementation, as well as pre-school activities. The centres may be used as depots for oral rehydration salts, basic medicines and contraceptives.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A. ASHA counsels women on birth preparedness, importance of safe delivery, breast feeding, immunization, contraception and reproductive tract infections. Options B and D. MO and trained birth attendants have no role in rural visits, as mentioned in the given scenario.

Extraedge:

Anganwadi worker = 1 per 400-800 in plains and 1 per 300-800 in hilly areas.

questions.text: 7 week pregnant female came to PHC and is having Hb 9%. When will you start iron tablet?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

8-10 wk Iron tablets in a case of anemia must be started at the earliest. Options A, C and D are false.

Highyeild:

Pregnant woman with mild- moderate anaemia is treated with: Two IFA tablets orally daily. IV iron sucrose or ferric carboxy maltose , in cases of anemia detected late in pregnancy, or unable to tolerate oral iron or poor compliance. Based on ICMR, anaemia is divided into the following: Mild 10-10.9gm% Moderate 7-9.9gm% Severe <7gm% Very Severe <4gm% Management of iron deficiency anaemia in pregnancy: Oral preparation s : The dose is approximately 180-200 mg of elemental iron per day (equivalent to 3 tablets).The treatment is continued until blood parameters return to normal levels. The reticulocyte count is the earliest indicator of improvement. After that, a maintenance dose of one tablet per day is taken. The maintenance dose should be continued throughout the pregnancy and for three months after delivery to replenish iron stores. Parenteral preparation : Parenteral iron is indicated in patients on hemo/peritoneal dialysis, malabsorption syndrome, and pregnant females with severe anaemia that is seen for the first time during the last 8-10 weeks. The rise in haemoglobin concentration after parenteral therapy is similar to that with oral iron , approximately 7 to 1 gm % per week . Parenteral iron is not given for a rapid rise in haemoglobin concentration. The main advantage of parenteral therapy over oral iron is the certainty of administration. Indications of Blood Transfusion: Severe anaemia seen beyond 36 weeks of pregnancy. Anaemia due to active blood loss. Refractory anemia. Associated infection.

Extraedge:

We use oral iron preparations till 30 weeks , and parenteral preparation in 30-36 weeks and blood transfusion after 36 weeks. Note: Hb% should be more than 7 at the time of delivery.
